message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SE, cs.MM, cs.OS

Reasoning: 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): The paper discusses a new covert channel in smartphones and identifies security vulnerabilities in Android OS. 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper investigates network covert channels in smartphones and examines the ability to employ the cellular voice channel as a potential medium of information leakage. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper discusses the development of an Android software audio modem to leak data through the cellular voice channel stream. 
- cs.MM (Multimedia): The paper discusses the ability to carry modulated speech-like data covertly through the cellular voice channel. 
- cs.OS (Operating Systems): The paper investigates and breaks Android security policies to implement a user-mode rootkit that opens the voice channels by stealthily answering an incoming voice call.
